verses.kjv: The word of the LORD came also unto me, saying,
verses.web: LORD’s word came also to me, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to me again and said,

verses.kjv: Thou shalt not take thee a wife, neither shalt thou have sons or daughters in this place.
verses.web: “You shall not take a wife, neither shall you have sons or daughters, in this place.”
verses.ct: "Don't marry a wife, and don't have sons or daughters in this place."

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD concerning the sons and concerning the daughters that are born in this place, and concerning their mothers that bare them, and concerning their fathers that begat them in this land;
verses.web: For LORD says concerning the sons and concerning the daughters who are born in this place, and concerning their mothers who bore them, and concerning their fathers who became their father in this land:
verses.ct: The LORD told me what would happen to the sons and daughters born in this place, along with the mothers who bore them and the fathers who raised them in this land:

verses.kjv: They shall die of grievous deaths; they shall not be lamented; neither shall they be buried; but they shall be as dung upon the face of the earth: and they shall be consumed by the sword, and by famine; and their carcases shall be meat for the fowls of heaven, and for the beasts of the earth.
verses.web: “They will die grievous deaths. They will not be lamented, neither will they be buried. They will be as dung on the surface of the ground. They will be consumed by the sword and by famine. Their dead bodies will be food for the birds of the sky and for the animals of the earth.”
verses.ct: "They will die horrible deaths. No one will mourn for them, and no one will bury them. Their bodies will lie on the ground like dung. They'll be killed by war and famine, and their corpses will become food for the birds of the heavens and the wild animals."

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD, Enter not into the house of mourning, neither go to lament nor bemoan them: for I have taken away my peace from this people, saith the LORD, even lovingkindness and mercies.
verses.web: For LORD says, “Don’t enter into the house of mourning. Don’t go to lament. Don’t bemoan them, for I have taken away my peace from this people,” says LORD, “even loving kindness and tender mercies.
verses.ct: The LORD also said, "Don't enter a house where people are mourning. Don't go to grieve or weep for them, because I have taken my peace away from this people," declares the LORD, "along with my loving kindness and mercy."

verses.kjv: Both the great and the small shall die in this land: they shall not be buried, neither shall men lament for them, nor cut themselves, nor make themselves bald for them:
verses.web: Both great and small will die in this land. They will not be buried. Men won’t lament for them, cut themselves, or make themselves bald for them.
verses.ct: "Rich and poor alike will die in this land. They won't be buried. No one will mourn for them, and no one will cut themselves or shave their heads in grief for them."

verses.kjv: Neither shall men tear themselves for them in mourning, to comfort them for the dead; neither shall men give them the cup of consolation to drink for their father or for their mother.
verses.web: Men won’t break bread for them in mourning, to comfort them for the dead. Men won’t give them the cup of consolation to drink for their father or for their mother.
verses.ct: "No one will share a meal with mourners to comfort them over the dead. No one will offer them the cup of consolation to drink when they lose a father or mother."

verses.kjv: Thou shalt not also go into the house of feasting, to sit with them to eat and to drink.
verses.web: “You shall not go into the house of feasting to sit with them, to eat and to drink.”
verses.ct: "And don't go into a house where people are celebrating to sit down and eat and drink with them."

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel; Behold, I will cause to cease out of this place in your eyes, and in your days, the voice of mirth, and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom, and the voice of the bride.
verses.web: For LORD of Armies, the God of Israel says: “Behold, I will cause to cease out of this place, before your eyes and in your days, the voice of mirth and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride.
verses.ct: For the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, says this: "Watch — right before your eyes, in your own lifetime, I will silence every sound of joy and gladness in this place. There will be no more voices of brides and grooms."

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, when thou shalt shew this people all these words, and they shall say unto thee, Wherefore hath the LORD pronounced all this great evil against us? or what is our iniquity? or what is our sin that we have committed against the LORD our God?
verses.web: It will happen, when you tell this people all these words, and they ask you, ‘Why has LORD pronounced all this great evil against us?’ or ‘What is our iniquity? or ‘What is our sin that we have committed against LORD our God?’
verses.ct: "When you tell this people everything I've said, they'll ask you, 'Why has the LORD declared such terrible things against us? What did we do wrong? What sin have we committed against the LORD our God?'"

verses.kjv: Then shalt thou say unto them, Because your fathers have forsaken me, saith the LORD, and have walked after other gods, and have served them, and have worshipped them, and have forsaken me, and have not kept my law;
verses.web: then you shall tell them, ‘Because your fathers have forsaken me,’ says LORD, ‘and have walked after other gods, have served them, have worshiped them, have forsaken me, and have not kept my law.
verses.ct: "Then tell them: 'Because your ancestors abandoned me,' declares the LORD. 'They chased after other gods, served them, and worshiped them. They turned their backs on me and refused to obey my law.'"

verses.kjv: And ye have done worse than your fathers; for, behold, ye walk every one after the imagination of his evil heart, that they may not hearken unto me:
verses.web: You have done evil more than your fathers, for behold, you each walk after the stubbornness of his evil heart, so that you don’t listen to me.
verses.ct: "'And you have been even worse than your ancestors! Look at yourselves — each of you stubbornly follows your own evil heart and refuses to listen to me.'"

verses.kjv: Therefore will I cast you out of this land into a land that ye know not, neither ye nor your fathers; and there shall ye serve other gods day and night; where I will not shew you favour.
verses.web: Therefore I will cast you out of this land into the land that you have not known, neither you nor your fathers. There you will serve other gods day and night, for I will show you no favor.’
verses.ct: "'So I will throw you out of this land into a foreign country that neither you nor your ancestors have ever known. There you'll serve other gods day and night, because I will show you no mercy.'"

verses.kjv: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that it shall no more be said, The LORD liveth, that brought up the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt;
verses.web: “Therefore behold, the days come,” says LORD, “that it will no more be said, ‘As LORD lives, who brought up the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt;’
verses.ct: "But listen — the days are coming," declares the LORD, "when people will no longer swear by saying, 'As surely as the LORD lives, who brought the people of Israel out of Egypt.'"

verses.kjv: But, The LORD liveth, that brought up the children of Israel from the land of the north, and from all the lands whither he had driven them: and I will bring them again into their land that I gave unto their fathers.
verses.web: but, ‘As LORD lives, who brought up the children of Israel from the land of the north, and from all the countries where he had driven them.’ I will bring them again into their land that I gave to their fathers.
verses.ct: "Instead, they'll say, 'As surely as the LORD lives, who brought the people of Israel back from the land of the north and from every country where he had scattered them.' I will bring them home again to the land I gave their ancestors."

verses.kjv: Behold, I will send for many fishers, saith the LORD, and they shall fish them; and after will I send for many hunters, and they shall hunt them from every mountain, and from every hill, and out of the holes of the rocks.
verses.web: “Behold, I will send for many fishermen,” says LORD, “and they will fish them up. Afterward I will send for many hunters, and they will hunt them from every mountain, from every hill, and out of the clefts of the rocks.
verses.ct: "But first, watch this," declares the LORD. "I'm sending for many fishermen, and they'll haul my people in like fish. After that, I'll send for many hunters, and they'll track them down on every mountain, every hill, and in every crack in the rocks."

verses.kjv: For mine eyes are upon all their ways: they are not hid from my face, neither is their iniquity hid from mine eyes.
verses.web: For my eyes are on all their ways. They are not hidden from my face. Their iniquity isn’t concealed from my eyes.
verses.ct: "My eyes see everything they do. Nothing is hidden from my face, and their sin is not concealed from my sight."

verses.kjv: And first I will recompense their iniquity and their sin double; because they have defiled my land, they have filled mine inheritance with the carcases of their detestable and abominable things.
verses.web: First I will recompense their iniquity and their sin double, because they have polluted my land with the carcasses of their detestable things, and have filled my inheritance with their abominations.”
verses.ct: "First, I will pay them back double for their sin and wickedness, because they have polluted my land with the rotting remains of their disgusting idols and filled my inheritance with their abominations."

verses.kjv: O LORD, my strength, and my fortress, and my refuge in the day of affliction, the Gentiles shall come unto thee from the ends of the earth, and shall say, Surely our fathers have inherited lies, vanity, and things wherein there is no profit.
verses.web: LORD, my strength, and my stronghold, and my refuge in the day of affliction, the nations will come to you from the ends of the earth, and will say, “Our fathers have inherited nothing but lies, vanity and things in which there is no profit.
verses.ct: LORD, you are my strength, my fortress, and my refuge in times of trouble. Nations will come to you from the ends of the earth and say, "Our ancestors inherited nothing but lies — worthless idols that did them no good at all."

verses.kjv: Shall a man make gods unto himself, and they are no gods?
verses.web: Should a man make to himself gods which yet are no gods?”
verses.ct: "Can people make their own gods? Those aren't gods at all!"

verses.kjv: Therefore, behold, I will this once cause them to know, I will cause them to know mine hand and my might; and they shall know that my name is The LORD.
verses.web: “Therefore behold, I will cause them to know, this once I will cause them to know my hand and my might. Then they will know that my name is LORD.”
verses.ct: "So this time I will make them understand. I will show them my power and my might, and they will know that my name is the LORD."
